byline.original: By BENJAMIN WEISER and VIVIAN YEE

abstract: Sheldon Silver, former New York State Assembly Speaker convicted on corruption charges, is sentenced to 12 years in prison; prosecutors sought long sentence for Silver in effort to make example of him and discourage malfeasance by other lawmakers; sentence comes as capstone to United States Atty Preet Bharara's campaign against official corruption.

headline.print_headline: Silver Is Given a 12-Year Term for Corruption
headline.main: Sheldon Silver, Ex-New York Assembly Speaker, Gets 12-Year Prison Sentence

snippet: Mr. Silver, a Democrat from the Lower East Side, was for decades one of Albany’s most powerful legislators before being convicted of multiple counts of corruption.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Silver, a Democrat from the Lower East Side, was for decades one of Albany’s most powerful legislators before being convicted of multiple counts of corruption.
